title: Grilled Swordfish with Salsa Verde
description: Thick swordfish steaks are grilled to a juicy, slightly charred finish and topped with a bright, herb-forward salsa verde. The salsa combines parsley, capers, lemon and olive oil for a tangy, savory contrast that highlights the meaty texture of the fish.

ingredients.notes: about 6 oz (200 g) each; patted dry

ingredients.display_name: extra virgin olive oil (for marinade and salsa)
ingredients.notes: divided: 2 tbsp for fish, 4 tbsp for salsa

ingredients.display_name: anchovy fillets (packed in oil), finely chopped

ingredients.notes: divided: season fish and adjust salsa if needed

steps.text: Prep fish and ingredients: pat swordfish steaks dry and season both sides with half the kosher salt and half the black pepper; let rest at room temperature while you make the salsa (about 5 minutes).

Make the salsa verde: in a medium bowl combine chopped parsley, minced garlic, minced shallot, chopped anchovy fillets (if using), capers, lemon juice, remaining olive oil, red pepper flakes, remaining salt and pepper; stir vigorously to emulsify and taste-adjust for acidity and seasoning.
Preheat the grill (or grill pan) to medium-high heat (about 450°F/230°C equivalent) and oil the grates or brush fish lightly with olive oil to prevent sticking.

Grill the swordfish: place steaks on the hot grill and cook undisturbed for 3 to 4 minutes to develop good grill marks, flip and cook 3 to 4 more minutes until opaque through the center and internal temperature reaches 130–135°F (54–57°C) for medium; thicker pieces may take slightly longer.
Rest and finish: transfer grilled steaks to a platter and let rest 2 minutes; spoon generous portions of the salsa verde over each steak and serve immediately with lemon wedges.
